senses.sense_definition: An expert or specialist in the study of the Americas, particularly their history, cultures, or languages.

examples.text: The famous <w>Americanist</w> delivered a lecture on colonial history.
She is a respected <w>Americanist</w> specializing in indigenous dialects.

senses.sense_definition: A person who strongly supports the culture, values, or political interests of the United States.

examples.text: As a devoted <w>Americanist</w>, he argued against foreign influence in domestic policy.
The rally attracted every local <w>Americanist</w> concerned about the new laws.

senses.sense_definition: A proponent or user of the Americanist phonetic notation system.

examples.text: The <w>Americanist</w> argued that the IPA was less suitable for these specific sounds.
Early linguistic fieldwork was often conducted by a dedicated <w>Americanist</w>.

senses.sense_definition: Favoring or pertaining to the values, culture, or political interests of the United States.

examples.text: The party adopted an <w>Americanist</w> platform during the election.
His <w>Americanist</w> perspective influenced his economic theories.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to a phonetic notation system developed for transcribing Native American and European languages.

examples.text: The textbook uses <w>Americanist</w> symbols instead of the standard IPA.
This dictionary follows the <w>Americanist</w> tradition of transcription.
